section_title: Expenditure in maintenance, &c., of war memorials.
section_text: 1 A local authority may incur reasonable expenditure in the maintenance, repair and protection of any war memorial within their district  whether vested in them or not.
3 The provisions of this Act shall not apply to a war memorial provided or maintained by a local authority in the exercise of any other statutory power.
4 In this Act the expression “ local authority ” means the council of a county, . . .  borough . . .  district or parish, and the parish meeting of a rural parish with no parish council.
5 This Act may be cited as the War Memorials (Local Authorities’ Powers) Act, 1923.
